metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: Git Clone from GitHub
Change Platform:
Clone a Fork from GitHub
Now we have our own fork , but only on GitHub. We also want a clone on our local Git to keep working on it.
content.html: Now we have our own fork, but only on GitHub. We also want a clone on our local Git to keep working on it.

content.text: A clone is a full copy of a repository, including all logging and versions of files.
content.html: A clone is a full copy of a repository, including all logging and versions of files.

content.text: Move back to the original repository, and click the green "Code" button to get the URL to clone :
content.html: Move back to the original repository, and click the green "Code" button to get the URL to clone:

content.text: Open your Git bash and clone the repository:
content.html: Open your Git bash and clone the repository:

content.code:
git
clone https://github.com/w3schools-test/w3schools-test.github.io.git
Cloning into 'w3schools-test.github.io'...
remote: Enumerating objects: 33, done.
remote: Counting objects: 100% (33/33), done.
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (15/15), done.
remote: Total 33 (delta 18), reused 33 (delta 18), pack-reused 0
Receiving objects: 100% (33/33), 94.79 KiB | 3.16 MiB/s, done.
Resolving deltas: 100% (18/18), done.
content.code_html:
git clone https://github.com/w3schools-test/w3schools-test.github.io.git
Cloning into 'w3schools-test.github.io'...
remote: Enumerating objects: 33, done.
remote: Counting objects: 100% (33/33), done.
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (15/15), done.
remote: Total 33 (delta 18), reused 33 (delta 18), pack-reused 0
Receiving objects: 100% (33/33), 94.79 KiB | 3.16 MiB/s, done.
Resolving deltas: 100% (18/18), done.

content.text: Take a look in your file system, and you will see a new directory named after the cloned project:
content.html: Take a look in your file system, and you will see a new directory named after the cloned project:

content.code_html:
ls
w3schools-test.github.io/

content.text: Note: To specify a specific folder to clone to, add the name of the folder after the repository URL , like this: git clone https://github.com/w3schools-test/w3schools-test.github.io.git myfolder
content.html: Note: To specify a specific folder to clone to, add the name of the folder after the repository URL, like this: git clone https://github.com/w3schools-test/w3schools-test.github.io.git myfolder

content.text: Navigate to the new directory, and check the status :
content.html: Navigate to the new directory, and check the status:

content.code:
cd
w3schools-test.github.io

git
status
On branch master
Your branch is up to date with 'origin/master'.

nothing to commit, working tree clean
content.code_html:
cd w3schools-test.github.io
git status
On branch master
Your branch is up to date with 'origin/master'.

nothing to commit, working tree clean

content.text: And check the log to confirm that we have the full repository data:
content.html: And check the log to confirm that we have the full repository data:

content.code:
git
log
commit facaeae8fd87dcb63629f108f401aa9c3614d4e6 (HEAD -> master, origin/master, origin/HEAD)
Merge: e7de78f 5a04b6f
Author: w3schools-test

Date:   Fri Mar 26 15:44:10 2021 +0100

Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/w3schools-test/hello-world

commit e7de78fdefdda51f6f961829fcbdf197e9b926b6
Author: w3schools-test

Date:   Fri Mar 26 15:37:22 2021 +0100

Updated index.html. Resized image

.....
content.code_html:
git log
commit facaeae8fd87dcb63629f108f401aa9c3614d4e6 (HEAD -> master, origin/master, origin/HEAD)
Merge: e7de78f 5a04b6f
Author: w3schools-test 
Date:   Fri Mar 26 15:44:10 2021 +0100

    Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/w3schools-test/hello-world

commit e7de78fdefdda51f6f961829fcbdf197e9b926b6
Author: w3schools-test 
Date:   Fri Mar 26 15:37:22 2021 +0100

    Updated index.html. Resized image
    
.....

content.text: Now we have a full copy of the original repository.
content.html: Now we have a full copy of the original repository.

content.text: Configuring Remotes
Basically, we have a full copy of a repository, whose origin we are not allowed to make changes to.
content.html: Basically, we have a full copy of a repository, whose origin we are not allowed to make changes to.

content.text: Let's see how the remotes of this Git is set up:
content.html: Let's see how the remotes of this Git is set up:

content.code_html:
git remote -v
origin  https://github.com/w3schools-test/w3schools-test.github.io.git (fetch)
origin  https://github.com/w3schools-test/w3schools-test.github.io.git (push)

content.text: We see that origin is set up to the original " w3schools-test " repository, we also want to add our own fork .
content.html: We see that origin is set up to the original "w3schools-test" repository, we also want to add our own fork.

content.text: First, we rename the original origin remote :
content.html: First, we rename the original origin remote:

content.code:
git
remote
rename
origin upstream

git
remote -v
upstream        https://github.com/w3schools-test/w3schools-test.github.io.git (fetch)
upstream        https://github.com/w3schools-test/w3schools-test.github.io.git (push)
content.code_html:
git remote rename origin upstream
git remote -v
upstream        https://github.com/w3schools-test/w3schools-test.github.io.git (fetch)
upstream        https://github.com/w3schools-test/w3schools-test.github.io.git (push)

content.text: Then fetch the URL of our own fork :
content.html: Then fetch the URL of our own fork:

content.text: And add that as origin :
content.html: And add that as origin:

content.code:
git
remote
add
origin https://github.com/kaijim/w3schools-test.github.io.git

git
remote -v
origin  https://github.com/kaijim/w3schools-test.github.io.git (fetch)
origin  https://github.com/kaijim/w3schools-test.github.io.git (push)
upstream        https://github.com/w3schools-test/w3schools-test.github.io.git (fetch)
upstream        https://github.com/w3schools-test/w3schools-test.github.io.git (push)
content.code_html:
git remote add origin https://github.com/kaijim/w3schools-test.github.io.git
git remote -v
origin  https://github.com/kaijim/w3schools-test.github.io.git (fetch)
origin  https://github.com/kaijim/w3schools-test.github.io.git (push)
upstream        https://github.com/w3schools-test/w3schools-test.github.io.git (fetch)
upstream        https://github.com/w3schools-test/w3schools-test.github.io.git (push)

content.text: Note: According to Git naming conventions, it is recommended to name your own repository origin , and the one you forked for upstream
content.html: Note: According to Git naming conventions, it is recommended to name your own repository origin, and the one you forked for upstream

content.text: Now we have 2 remotes:
content.html: Now we have 2 remotes:

content.text: Now we are going to make some changes to the code. In the next chapter, we will cover how we suggest those changes to the original repository.
content.html: Now we are going to make some changes to the code. In the next chapter, we will cover how we suggest those changes to the original repository.
